ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend it if you are willing to put in the work. Sometimes the problem sets can be tedious calculations.

I would say that QFT II is not a course to take if you are just looking to get a good grade or if you aren't that interested but are just looking for a course. QFT II requires a lot of reading and time on homework's but is well worth the time if you are motivated to learn the subject.
It was a good introduction to renormalization, non-abelian gauge theories and the standard model

It is a difficult but rewarding course covering material all the way to the Standard Model. I would only recommend it to a student who actually thinks they will get something of it (ie it is related to their field). Otherwise, it just too much work.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I will have a nice theory section in my thesis from this class...
This course definitely contributed to my interest in field theory, particle physics, and in deciding to pursue this area of research in grad school.
I got a good idea about the topics we covered and I think they will be helpful as a basis for the future research I want to do.
